subject_terms_3: 1942-1945 Japanese occupation Portrait photography war personalities
physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a man in a suit. He is standing with his arms poised on his waist. He is standing on a step of a building, with a half-opened door on his left. The photograph is placed on a plain white card. There are no inscriptions on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: "A carved wooden ""In Memoriam"" plaque commemorating Lt. G.C. Kerr who was killed in action in Singapore on Feb 10th 1942. It would have possibly been assembled during internment and speaks to P.O.W efforts to remember their fallen comrades. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele
title_text: "A carved wooden ""In Memoriam"" plaque commemorating ""Lt. G.C. Kerr. Killed in Action. Singapore. Feb 10th 1942"" and 1 postcard" Lt. G. C. Kerr
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Portrait photography Prisoners of war
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
